content: tip 1 if you are like me and knit mindlessly not paying attention to what row you are on use a stitch marker at the end of your work where the increase & decrease occur tip 2 try slipping the 1st stitch on every right side row for a neater edge finishing using left over yarn and some cardboard 15 - 18cm / 6 - 7 width or whatever you have at hand wrap remaining yarn around cut the strands at 1 side take a handful of the strands or as many as desired and using a crochet hook pull them through the ends of the cowldana to form a loop pull the end of the tassels through the loop and pull tight to lock them in place use the cast on / bind off tails to sew through the tassel knot and secure the tassel in place steam or wet block if required your cowldana is complete why not create your very own unique cowldana using up all your scrappy yarn use the chart on the next page to create a custom colour combo don t forget to take a picture of your newest fashion accessory and tag @me_i_knit & #cowldana on instagram & facebook happy wearing thank you for downloading this pattern as an indie designer it means the world to me to see my designs come to life in your hands cowldana neckwarmer © 2022 me i knit all rights reserved photos and pattern are the property of deirdre liston me i knit and may not be altered shared or sold you may sell finished products using this pattern
